page.title: 17May Day 1985.
page.content: By tradition we have our May Day on a Saturday afternoon.After the town crier welcomes in visitors the May Queen parades round with the petal throwers in front.The children sit down and the May Queen is crowned by the previous May Queen who is given a bouquet by the flower-girl,one of the youngest children.The septre-bearer makes her speech and it is followed by the May Queen commanding the dancing to start. The programme includes country dances, sword,morris and may-pole dancing.This year we had a balloon race to see whose balloon went the furthest.After the celebration there were drinks, cakes,crisps and icecream to have in our school hall. It was a beautiful warm day this year.
